intro: Hieracium ancotum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a purple center. Hieracium ancotum is often found in temperate climates and can be invasive in certain regions.
